title: Sketchbook Folio, "The Battle Between the Romans and the Sabines; Apparition of Romulus to Proculus, Two Studies after the Carracci; Candelabrum", 1821–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over traces of black chalk on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Lodovico Carracci Bologna; at lower left: 46 Lodovico Caracci Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing of two figures in combat, warrior with sword and shield, and woman with babe in arms. Other figures in combat in background, and at both sides. Lower left, kneeling old man in robes, with warrior figure in mid air above and to right. Lower right, candelabrum flanked by putti at base, and by nude females above, both pairs holding garlands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sketchbook Folio, "The Battle Between the Romans and the Sabines; Apparition of Romulus to Proculus, Two Studies after the Carracci; Candelabrum", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over traces of black chalk on white heavy wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3584-a/c.
